etymology.description: semantic: 日 ‘sun’ + 月 ‘moon’ — sun rising while moon not yet set → dawn; alternatively two bright celestial bodies → bright.
etymology.interpretation: Combining the sun and moon evokes two sources of light, symbolizing brightness and clarity. This core idea extends to senses like ‘understand’ (clarity of mind) and temporal uses in compounds such as 明天 ‘next day’.

examples.chinese: 灯光很明亮(燈光很明亮)。
我明白你的意思(我明白你的意思)。
我们明天再联系(我們明天再聯繫)。
examples.english: Let’s get in touch again tomorrow.
